summary: Website for business calculations with a column-based table to enter, view, and track items, with a sky-blue/white theme and support for user-customizable columns.
architectural_notes: Support a flexible record schema to accommodate user-defined (custom) columns.
known_issues: App theme is not correctly applied as sky-blue and white as required (appears inconsistent/wrong theme).

existing_features.title: Create a main table screen that displays business calculation records in a column-based format with the exact columns: Sr. No., SOR no., Item, quantity, rate, Amount, status, order no., Order quantity, order rate, order GST, order amount, supplier, supplier name, final status.
Provide table interactions to add, edit, and delete records from the UI, with inline editable cells (text/number inputs and dropdowns where appropriate).

Implement automatic calculations for derived fields: Amount = quantity × rate; order amount = Order quantity × order rate × (1 + order GST/100). Recalculate these fields immediately when dependent inputs change.
Add backend persistence for records in the single Motoko actor so that records can be created, listed, updated, and deleted from the frontend.

Define and enforce data types/validation rules: numeric fields (quantity, rate, Order quantity, order rate, order GST) must accept only valid numbers; show clear inline error messages for invalid input and prevent saving invalid records.

Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme across the app (typography, spacing, table styling, buttons, and form inputs) suitable for a business spreadsheet-like workflow, using a warm neutral palette with emerald accents (avoid blue/purple).
Update the app’s visual theme to a sky-blue and white palette across backgrounds, table styling, buttons, inputs, and header elements (remove the current emerald/warm-neutral look).
Add a UI that lets users create, rename, reorder, and delete custom (user-defined) columns for the business calculations table.

Render custom columns alongside the existing fixed business columns in the main table, with inline editing support for custom column cells and appropriate validation based on each custom column’s type.
Add a supplier-wise report view that groups existing business records by `supplierName` and displays each group with a subtotal of `Amount` (calculated as `quantity × rate`).
Show totals at the end of the supplier-wise report, including (1) a subtotal row at the end of each supplier section and (2) a grand total row at the very end of the report across all suppliers.
Provide a basic export/print option for the supplier-wise report so users can take the grouped totals outside the app.

Make the app’s visual theme consistently sky-blue and white across all pages and components by eliminating conflicting global theme definitions and ensuring the active Tailwind CSS variables resolve to a sky-blue/white palette.

Fix the global theme token definitions so the active Tailwind semantic colors (bg-background, bg-card, text-foreground, border-border, text-primary, bg-muted/*, bg-primary/*, etc.) render as a sky-blue and white palette in the running app.

Eliminate conflicting or incorrect global theme sources so there is a single, consistent source of truth for CSS variables used by Tailwind theme tokens, and ensure the imported global stylesheet defines variables in the format expected by the Tailwind config.

Update the Supplier-Wise Report page to group records by supplier name and display per-record order fields: Order Quantity, Order Rate, Order GST, and Order Amount (calculated as orderQuantity × orderRate × (1 + orderGst/100)), along with a total amount at the end of each supplier section and a grand total at the end of the report based on Order Amount.

Update the supplier-wise report CSV export to include the same order-related columns (Order Quantity, Order Rate, Order GST, Order Amount) and ensure subtotal and grand total rows reflect summed Order Amount values.

Add two new fixed date columns to the main Business Calculations table UI: (1) "SOR Date" displayed immediately before "SOR No", and (2) "Order Date" displayed immediately before "Order No". Both columns must support inline add/edit behavior consistent with existing fixed columns.

Extend the BusinessRecord TypeScript types and frontend data layer to include the two new fields: `sorDate` and `orderDate`, and ensure these fields are included in create/update flows and mock seed data so the app continues to function end-to-end without runtime/type errors.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a web app with a tabular data-entry/view interface for business calculations using columns: Sr. No., SOR no., Item, quantity, rate, Amount, status, order no., order quantity, order rate, order GST, order amount, supplier, supplier name, final status.
Update the app visual theme to sky blue and white across backgrounds, table styling, buttons, and inputs.
Allow users to create/manage multiple (custom) columns as per their needs (user-defined columns).
Persist custom column definitions and per-record custom column values in the Motoko backend so that they are retained across reloads and available to authenticated users when they return.
If the backend’s persisted state schema must change to support custom columns, add a conditional migration to preserve existing stored data during upgrade.
Add a report view/export that groups records by supplier name and shows a total amount at the end (per supplier and/or grand total).

Audit key UI surfaces (table headers/rows, buttons, dialogs, and highlight rows) and update any hardcoded/legacy color usages so they use the semantic Tailwind tokens (bg-background, bg-card, text-foreground, text-muted-foreground, text-primary, border-border, bg-muted/*, bg-primary/*) and visually match the sky-blue/white theme.

Audit key UI surfaces (table header/rows, buttons, dialogs, page headers/footers, and highlighted rows) and replace any remaining hardcoded/legacy color utility classes with semantic Tailwind tokens so they inherit the sky-blue/white theme consistently.
Enhance the supplier-wise report to display order quantity, order rate, order GST, and (order) amount per record, and show a total amount at the end of the report.
Add two new date columns to the main table: 'SOR Date' placed before 'SOR No.' and 'Order Date' placed before 'Order No.' (including support for entry/editing and persistence).

Update the Motoko backend BusinessRecord persistence to store and return the new `sorDate` and `orderDate` fields as part of business calculation records, so that when backend persistence is used these two date values round-trip correctly through create/list/update operations. Add a conditional migration if needed to preserve existing stored records during upgrade.
